sect2.title: Better System Tools
sect2.para: GNOME's system administration tools now monitor for changes in the configuration file's they're editing. This means if another administrator changes the configuration, your display is updated to reflect this.
The Share Administrator now allows you to edit the SMB user database (smbpasswd).
The Network Administrator can now set up PPPoE and GPRS connections.

sect2.title: Simplified Keyboard Settings
sect2.para: The keyboard layout and keyboard accessibility preferences have been merged into one dialog, putting every keyboard setting you need in one place. Desktop Keyboard Shortcuts remain separate.

sect2.title: New Mouse Accessibility
sect2.para: GNOME 2.22 now includes a set of special accessibility enhancements for controlling the mouse. Features include:

listitem.para: the ability to open the contextual menu with only one mouse button; and
the ability to perform different types of clicks (e.g. single click, double click, dragging) without using a mouse button (usually referred to as a dwelling).
